column4: anyone else have more hopeful answers for recovering my wife's deleted photo folder?
there is a photorec program which might be able to find some hidden photos (probably will also find all the images in your firefox cache so its going to be a high chaff to wheat ration)
if its not showing up on the bus at all that would seem to indicate a problem with the usb hub. what usb modules are loaded (lsmod)
http://pastebin.com/VJRG43i1
is that before or after you unplugged/replugged
after replugged.
want to see it from before
okay, will reboot now, run lsmod, jump back to irc.
wd passport not showing up. lsmod results are at http://pastebin.com/2D0jwXej
try sudo modprobe usb_storage (doubt it will do anything but worth a shot
no results
it doesnt show up now?
nope, it doesn't show up. Incidentally, when usb drive is plugged in at boot time, boot time doubles or triples.
boot time after the kernel is started?
have black screen for a long time before purple background shows up. also using usb lenovo remote keyboard/trackball. Wonder if that creates conflict.

i would suspect that the bios is trying to boot the usb and is really slow to scan the bus. perhaps the bios is also buggy and is failing to release it so that it doesn't reinitialize when the kernel comes up. remove usb from our boot order
good idea. will try. thanks for help so far. if you're still here, i'll let you know what happens.
You must be some sort of genius. It worked. I disabled usb storage in the boot options of BIOS.
speculation pure speculation
So, if I have two usb drives and want to boot from one, not the other, I basically am out of luck thanks to buggy BIOS?
sounds like it
if you have multiple controllers try to put it on a different bus/controller. maybe it keeps the one bus up so that it can pass it to grub, and will take down the other
Thanks a ton for your help. Couldn't have done it without you.
